channel.title: Personal Site Design feedback
channel.description:
This is a site I'm setting up as something nice to pop up when possible employers google my name. Any one have any design ideas?
http://koolvinstine.com

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Thats pretty good, though the background looks a little blurred. Maybe pick a different one with alot of blue.

Try these:

DeviantArt

the Gate in the Clouds

� � � Q U I N T E S S E N C E 2nd piece of the "Quintessence" series. 1st piece here: Luminance on the Clouds made with a beautiful stock by `wroth I changed the colors a bit and I added some light...

Read full topic

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:22, topic:339372”]I like the old background better.[/quote]Current isn’t permanent, was messing around with it and something came up.
EDIT: How’s this one? It’s a background taken straight from Ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:20, topic:339372”][quote author=Koolvin link=topic=435756.msg3202131#msg3202131 date=1273426858]

the header is fucking nasty

at first glance, it seems it’s a site to entertain children (the horrific linear background, the random flintstones character, etc)
[/quote]Flintstone was boredom, the background doesn’t seem too childish to me. Anyone else think the linear background is childish?

you shouldn’t be implementing things just because you’re bored. this is supposed to be a real website, not some thing you’re making for shits and giggles. and yes, that background style is a bit amateurish.

the design isn’t bad, it’s just not appropriate for what you’re doing[/quote]Alright, thank you, I’ll work on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:19, topic:339372”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=435756.msg3201971#msg3201971 date=1273421725]
the header is fucking nasty

at first glance, it seems it’s a site to entertain children (the horrific linear background, the random flintstones character, etc)
[/quote]Flintstone was boredom, the background doesn’t seem too childish to me. Anyone else think the linear background is childish?[/quote]
you shouldn’t be implementing things just because you’re bored. this is supposed to be a real website, not some thing you’re making for shits and giggles. and yes, that background style is a bit amateurish.

the design isn’t bad, it’s just not appropriate for what you’re doing

Read full topic

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:15, topic:339372”][quote author=Koolvin link=topic=435756.msg3201716#msg3201716 date=1273393625]

Im going to guess that that is a transparent PNG, older browsers still don’t support this so you would be better off with a transparent GIF.

EDIT: NVm i thought the text was transparent but I was wrong

anyway, here you can see your site in almost any browser:
http://browsershots.org/http://www.koolvinstine.com/
[/quote]Yes. In the future I’ll make it with images instead of border radius’s. Any suggestions on the design how it’s suppose to look ( chrome or firefox )? Too plain?

Chrome is on that list.[/quote]Yeah…

[quote=“cane, post:16, topic:339372”]Im using chrome and it looks fine, also you should use lipsum.org to fill in your content areas.[/quote]I mean how should I change how it is currently. What could look better?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

Im going to guess that that is a transparent PNG, older browsers still don’t support this so you would be better off with a transparent GIF.

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:11, topic:339372”][quote author=Koolvin link=topic=435756.msg3201395#msg3201395 date=1273362888]

[quote author=eczema3 link=topic=435756.msg3201124#msg3201124 date=1273342206]

[quote author=Koolvin link=topic=435756.msg3201018#msg3201018 date=1273336443]

http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http://www.koolvinstine.com/&charset=(detect+automatically)&doctype=Inline&group=0
http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/validator?uri=koolvinstine.com&profile=css21&usermedium=all&warning=1&lang=en

nice and valid, gj
[/quote]fixed.

too wide.
[/quote]Fixed

you didn’t fix the css, or if you did you broke it again since.
[/quote]It’s fixed. Webkit isn’t css 2.1, so it shows an error. That is, unless you have a specific problem.

it’s not fixed by the standards of the w3c, which is what defines “fixed”… so no, it’s not fixed. You’re using browser-specific properties that aren’t defined in the CSS2.1 specification.[/quote]It works 100% the webkit only serves to make it look better in gecko based browsers, and mozilla.

Read full topic

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:10, topic:339372”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=435756.msg3201124#msg3201124 date=1273342206]

[quote author=Koolvin link=topic=435756.msg3201018#msg3201018 date=1273336443]

[quote author=eczema3 link=topic=435756.msg3200833#msg3200833 date=1273327009]
http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http://www.koolvinstine.com/&charset=(detect+automatically)&doctype=Inline&group=0
http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/validator?uri=koolvinstine.com&profile=css21&usermedium=all&warning=1&lang=en

nice and valid, gj
[/quote]fixed.

too wide.
[/quote]Fixed

you didn’t fix the css, or if you did you broke it again since.
[/quote]It’s fixed. Webkit isn’t css 2.1, so it shows an error. That is, unless you have a specific problem.[/quote]
it’s not fixed by the standards of the w3c, which is what defines “fixed”… so no, it’s not fixed. You’re using browser-specific properties that aren’t defined in the CSS2.1 specification.

Read full topic

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Some people don’t have 1000px of actual space in the content area of their browser, and not simply because they are using 800x600.

Why don’t you just make the page width change depending on the space available using percentages?

Then you’ll have to make that massive logo thing smaller (800px?), and that can essentially set the minimum width.

Read full topic

item.title: Personal Site Design feedback
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

The content area itself is 1000px wide.

Do people still use 800x600?

Read full topic
